title: Continuous Separation Chromatography Process Design Through Iterative Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic chemical processes and data analysis capabilities
context.additional_context: Blended course for working professionals conducted outside work hours, combining online theoretical learning with offline practical training, and conducting simulations using digital devices (tablets/laptops)

learning_goals: Learners can explain the basic principles and operating conditions of the Simulated Moving Bed (SMB) process.
An online technique is applied to recalculate physical model parameters using real-time data (UV signals).
Purity optimization strategies for separation processes can be established through iterative learning design.
Enhance process design capabilities by implementing a collaborative process between physics-based and empirical-based models
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
